I'm not doing a very good job.

245
00:12:17.705 --> 00:12:21.635
All Typekit subscriptions include the same
font licensing whether you try it out for

246
00:12:21.635 --> 00:12:25.045
our free plan, upgrade to
the paid Typekit subscription or

247
00:12:25.045 --> 00:12:26.855
subscribe to Creative Cloud.

248
00:12:26.855 --> 00:12:30.960
So you can see that it's, that gives you
the options, but just always double check

249
00:12:30.960 --> 00:12:35.060
all of these things, can I use it in
my logo, can I use it in my website?

250
00:12:35.060 --> 00:12:36.490
And it will let you know, so

251
00:12:36.490 --> 00:12:39.220
it will say yes you can do this and
no you can't do that.

252
00:12:39.220 --> 00:12:42.870
So just always watch that,
you always want to be on the right side,

253
00:12:42.870 --> 00:12:44.630
rather than the wrong side.

254
00:12:44.630 --> 00:12:47.400
So I'm not gonna go over every single
one of those cuz you can go ahead and

255
00:12:47.400 --> 00:12:48.330
look that up.

256
00:12:48.330 --> 00:12:52.865
And the other thing, since we talked about
packaging, [COUGH] when packaging using

257
00:12:52.865 --> 00:12:57.740
synced fonts in your type kit,
synced fonts in Illustrator.

258
00:12:57.740 --> 00:13:00.570
It does say you do have to be
a little careful about that,

259
00:13:00.570 --> 00:13:03.840
like you really should if you're
sending it to somebody else.

260
00:13:03.840 --> 00:13:06.990
They should have their own
creative cloud subscription and

261
00:13:06.990 --> 00:13:11.120
have their own downloaded
copy of that font to use.

262
00:13:11.120 --> 00:13:14.160
And really just saying,
you know the best case scenario.

263
00:13:14.160 --> 00:13:17.160
Really what you're doing for
print output is you always make a PDF.

264
00:13:17.160 --> 00:13:20.710
Is you always make that high quality PDF
and we'll talk about that when we get into

265
00:13:20.710 --> 00:13:23.350
our exporting options of
your illustrator file.

266
00:13:23.350 --> 00:13:24.710
So that's always the way to go but

267
00:13:24.710 --> 00:13:28.370
you always want that backup for
having the font with the files.

268
00:13:28.370 --> 00:13:32.983
But, just be aware that and
just know what it entails and just,

269
00:13:32.983 --> 00:13:35.085
always go to the help files.

270
00:13:35.085 --> 00:13:36.960
When in doubt, go to the help files,
>> That's true.

271
00:13:36.960 --> 00:13:38.617
>> And
they're actually pretty helpful, so.

272
00:13:38.617 --> 00:13:40.780
>> Always good, always good.

273
00:13:40.780 --> 00:13:43.990
Alright Von, well we appreciate that,
thank you for straightening us out on what

274
00:13:43.990 --> 00:13:47.500
it means to have a missing font,
and what the type kit is.

275
00:13:47.500 --> 00:13:48.560
Very useful stuff there.

276
00:13:48.560 --> 00:13:51.890
We thank you hope everybody out there
enjoyed watching, signing off for

277
00:13:51.890 --> 00:13:54.310
ITPRO TV,
I've been your host Mike Rodrick.

278
00:13:54.310 --> 00:13:56.061
>> I'm Von Smith.
>> And we'll see you next time.

279
00:13:56.061 --> 00:14:02.313
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: Character and Paragraph Formatting
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.289 --> 00:00:12.789
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.710 --> 00:00:16.910
I'm your host, Mike Roderick.

4
00:00:16.910 --> 00:00:19.581
And today,
we're doing Adobe Illustrator CC 2015.

5
00:00:19.581 --> 00:00:24.403
And specifically in this episode,
we're gonna be taking a look at character

6
00:00:24.403 --> 00:00:27.800
formatting, as well as
paragraph formatting.

7
00:00:27.800 --> 00:00:30.150
And here to help us with
that is Ms Vonne Smith.

8
00:00:30.150 --> 00:00:30.756
How are you doing, Vonne?

9
00:00:30.756 --> 00:00:34.472
>> Good, glad to be here to talk about
what you just said, which is character and

10
00:00:34.472 --> 00:00:36.010
paragraph formatting.

11
00:00:36.010 --> 00:00:39.100
Gotta make our text look
the way we want it to look.

12
00:00:39.100 --> 00:00:42.063
And make sure our paragraphs look
the way we want our paragraphs to look.

13
00:00:42.063 --> 00:00:43.062
[LAUGH]
>> Absolutely.

14
00:00:43.062 --> 00:00:47.084
>> Yes, so this is continuing on from
the concepts that we learned about in

15
00:00:47.084 --> 00:00:48.950
the typography lesson.

16
00:00:48.950 --> 00:00:50.340
Now we're actually going to apply it.

17
00:00:50.340 --> 00:00:51.950
We're going to look at all
of the different panels,

18
00:00:51.950 --> 00:00:56.250
where you can find where to format,
how to format, what it means,

19
00:00:56.250 --> 00:01:00.400
what it looks like, and then talk
a little bit about styles as well.

20
00:01:00.400 --> 00:01:03.230
So it's all about applying the formats.

21
00:01:03.230 --> 00:01:06.765
We haven't actually gone
to adding the text yet or

22
00:01:06.765 --> 00:01:09.755
well, maybe you've already watched
the Adding the Text lesson.

23
00:01:09.755 --> 00:01:13.295
But the way I'm doing this is I'm kinda
talking about concepts, how to apply it,

24
00:01:13.295 --> 00:01:15.090
and then we'll actually add the text, so

25
00:01:15.090 --> 00:01:18.504
that way, we're kind of designing
backwards, the way I always like to do it.

26
00:01:18.504 --> 00:01:19.072
>> I like it.

27
00:01:19.072 --> 00:01:21.699
>> All right, so let's jump right in and

28
00:01:21.699 --> 00:01:26.296
just to recap some of the last little
bit of the typography lesson is

29
00:01:26.296 --> 00:01:31.080
there are certain things that they
consider character formatting.

30
00:01:31.080 --> 00:01:34.390
Like the actual letters and then the
paragraphs, which would be where you hit

31
00:01:34.390 --> 00:01:38.210
that Enter mark, where you say yes,
I want a new paragraph as I'm typing.

32
00:01:39.480 --> 00:01:42.029
So things like the letting and kerning,
and so I'm gonna show you how that works.

33
00:01:42.029 --> 00:01:46.291
But the one thing I forgot to put in
this little list of character formatting

34
00:01:46.291 --> 00:01:50.351
is the font, like actually choosing
the font, where do we go for that,

35
00:01:50.351 --> 00:01:52.280
so let's start there.

36
00:01:52.280 --> 00:01:56.730
I've got my black arrow tool cuz I do
want everything that's in this text box

37
00:01:56.730 --> 00:02:00.040
to have formatting.

38
00:02:00.040 --> 00:02:01.170
So I mean, if I just clicked here,

39
00:02:01.170 --> 00:02:05.770
it means all of the letters or
everything in here is going to apply.

40
00:02:05.770 --> 00:02:09.040
If I only wanted like one word,
you would then, with the black arrow tool,

41
00:02:09.040 --> 00:02:13.190
just double click to go ahead and get
the T tool to be able to select the text.

42
00:02:13.190 --> 00:02:18.382
So it's all about selective effects that
still applies here, but I'm just gonna

43
00:02:18.382 --> 00:02:23.211
stay with the black arrow tool to just
get the whole text frame, or text box.

44
00:02:23.211 --> 00:02:23.827
>> Okay.

45
00:02:23.827 --> 00:02:28.682
>> If you have a wider resolution monitor,
you will have across the top

46
00:02:28.682 --> 00:02:33.452
on your tool options bar,
it will give you some fonts and character

47
00:02:33.452 --> 00:02:38.900
because my resolution is a little bit
lower to show on the screen here.

48
00:02:38.900 --> 00:02:42.320
It's not actually showing like
the dropdown, where I can choose a font or

49
00:02:42.320 --> 00:02:43.410
choose a style.

50
00:02:43.410 --> 00:02:45.735
So mine's a little bit smaller, but

51
00:02:45.735 --> 00:02:50.760
you do have the underlines here that will
let you know that the character panel,

52
00:02:50.760 --> 00:02:55.950
like quick release, I don't know,
[LAUGH] all right, it's right there, okay.

53
00:02:55.950 --> 00:02:59.090
It actually brings the panel for
any options, and of course,

54
00:02:59.090 --> 00:03:00.580
you also have the paragraph.

55
00:03:00.580 --> 00:03:02.571
I'm going to, for
this demonstration purposes and

56
00:03:02.571 --> 00:03:05.105
to show you where you can find
the other ones in the Window menu, and

57
00:03:05.105 --> 00:03:08.290
I just realized as soon as I clicked on
them, I'm like wait, it's all grayed out.

58
00:03:08.290 --> 00:03:10.420
The reason it's grayed out is
cuz I have text selected, and

59
00:03:10.420 --> 00:03:13.890
it doesn't like you to choose
panels when you have it selected.

60
00:03:13.890 --> 00:03:14.550
>> Interesting.

61
00:03:14.550 --> 00:03:16.920
>> Yeah, I always thought that was,
and I keep doing that.

62
00:03:16.920 --> 00:03:19.061
So I was like,
I just did it again on camera.

63
00:03:19.061 --> 00:03:21.130
All right, so
let me click off of it first.

64
00:03:21.130 --> 00:03:24.840
And let's go back to Windows, and now you
can see down at the bottom, we have Type.

65
00:03:24.840 --> 00:03:29.540
And you have all of the different types
of type panels that are available for

66
00:03:29.540 --> 00:03:30.700
you to have, that's a mouthful.

67
00:03:30.700 --> 00:03:34.150
So if I go to Character right there,

68
00:03:34.150 --> 00:03:38.050
you can see that it's going to
give me the choice for my font.

69
00:03:38.050 --> 00:03:41.820
Or it's actually here, it's saying
Font Family, and then the style.

70
00:03:43.000 --> 00:03:45.820
Before I forget, if your panel
doesn't look like mine, remember,

71
00:03:45.820 --> 00:03:49.390
you always have the options, so the Panel
Options button might have the hide option,

72
00:03:49.390 --> 00:03:51.640
so if you don't see that, that's why.

73
00:03:51.640 --> 00:03:53.065
So I'm just gonna go ahead and show that.

74
00:03:53.065 --> 00:03:55.604
Okay, so let me go back to
where I have my text selected.

75
00:03:55.604 --> 00:03:57.570
And I can go here to my font, and

76
00:03:57.570 --> 00:04:02.750
it'll give me all the different fonts
that I have installed on my machine here.

77
00:04:02.750 --> 00:04:05.030
I'm gonna move this over a little bit,
so you all can see that.

78
00:04:05.030 --> 00:04:06.080
All right, so there we go.

79
00:04:06.080 --> 00:04:08.780
So I've got my fonts, and
it's gonna give me the samples

80
00:04:08.780 --> 00:04:12.500
of the font right next to it, so
I can see what it looks like.

81
00:04:12.500 --> 00:04:16.930
And just really quickly here,
the TT versus the O,

82
00:04:16.930 --> 00:04:18.890
what do you think that in the case there,
Mike?

83
00:04:18.890 --> 00:04:23.240
>> I'm gonna say that's Open Type
fonts versus True Type fonts.

84
00:04:23.240 --> 00:04:23.964
>> Correct.
[LAUGH] So

85
00:04:23.964 --> 00:04:27.731
you can know what type of font
it's going to be, and whether or

86
00:04:27.731 --> 00:04:30.701
not you're going to have
the possible option for

87
00:04:30.701 --> 00:04:35.060
those extra characters that open type
fonts will go ahead and show you.

88
00:04:35.060 --> 00:04:38.220
So here I can just pick,
like I have this one,

89
00:04:38.220 --> 00:04:43.750
you won't have this font on your
machine because I was doing a project,

90
00:04:43.750 --> 00:04:47.835
where it needed to look like rock letters,
right?

91
00:04:47.835 --> 00:04:52.180
So I used this all age demo that
I downloaded and what have you.

92
00:04:52.180 --> 00:04:54.850
But you can see some other ones here,
Arial.

93
00:04:54.850 --> 00:04:55.749
But like, what does that say?

94
00:04:55.749 --> 00:04:59.918
Like Arial versus this,
I mean like it says something.

95
00:04:59.918 --> 00:05:04.882
Like what font you choose is the look,
I don't think you'd probably want

96
00:05:04.882 --> 00:05:09.219
your Apple Chauncery for
a rock concert T-shirt [LAUGH] or logo.

97
00:05:09.219 --> 00:05:12.790
It just doesn't say it.

98
00:05:12.790 --> 00:05:15.671
So you can pick whatever font,
and then of course,

99
00:05:15.671 --> 00:05:18.084
you have the font style available for you.

100
00:05:18.084 --> 00:05:21.777
But your font style depends
on what font family or

101
00:05:21.777 --> 00:05:25.110
what font you're actually choosing.

102
00:05:25.110 --> 00:05:29.532
So, for example, we'll just go with Arial.

103
00:05:29.532 --> 00:05:32.376
And by the way, I'm just coming
up here and just typing it, so

104
00:05:32.376 --> 00:05:36.220
it gives me like a kind of a quick jump
down into this long list of fonts I have.

105
00:05:36.220 --> 00:05:40.040
With Arial, I have regular,
italic, bold, and bold italic.

106
00:05:40.040 --> 00:05:43.652
Great, but do you see that that other,
that Apple Chauncery or that all ages,

107
00:05:43.652 --> 00:05:47.464
it's not gonna have bold italic because
it just doesn't exist within that font.

108
00:05:47.464 --> 00:05:54.270
Okay, and some of them, I have a lot more,
like Minion Pro is one that I use a lot.

109
00:05:54.270 --> 00:05:58.090
And if you look at that, it's like,
there's a whole bunch in here.

110
00:05:58.090 --> 00:06:02.370
You see that I have semi-bold, and
bold, so you have different degrees.

111
00:06:02.370 --> 00:06:04.230
And some of them have even more of them,
so not-

112
00:06:04.230 --> 00:06:05.790
>> So it's not the application that's

113
00:06:05.790 --> 00:06:09.120
taking that font and
making it bold or making it italics.

114
00:06:09.120 --> 00:06:13.870
It's up to the font designer to include
a set of the letters that's in italics,

115
00:06:13.870 --> 00:06:15.630
a set of the letters that's bold.

116
00:06:15.630 --> 00:06:18.050
>> Exactly, yeah, and
not all fonts the same.

117
00:06:18.050 --> 00:06:22.080
And so that's why picking a font that
gives you a lot of variations or

118
00:06:22.080 --> 00:06:27.000
styles is good for
me as a designer because I can stay within

119
00:06:27.000 --> 00:06:29.320
the same font and
have a lot of different looks.

120
00:06:29.320 --> 00:06:33.740
But not go so extreme to where I have
like six different fonts on a brochure.

121
00:06:33.740 --> 00:06:36.890
That's just not really
a good design practice.

122
00:06:36.890 --> 00:06:40.450
You wanna try to keep within
two to three fonts at the most.

123
00:06:40.450 --> 00:06:42.250
I mean you do want contrast,
like your headings and

124
00:06:42.250 --> 00:06:45.360
your body text to look a little different,
but you don't wanna go so extreme,

125
00:06:45.360 --> 00:06:50.567
where it's like a full on font party and
it's not a good party.

126
00:06:50.567 --> 00:06:53.905
[LAUGH] So
those are just things to think about.

127
00:06:53.905 --> 00:06:56.630
So that's how you can change what font

128
00:06:56.630 --> 00:07:01.828
you want to apply to whatever text you
have selected, font and font style.

129
00:07:01.828 --> 00:07:06.340
Okay, so
[COUGH] let's move on to some of the other

130
00:07:06.340 --> 00:07:09.180
character level formatting
that we have on this list.

131
00:07:09.180 --> 00:07:11.350
And again, I'm gonna put this over here.

132
00:07:11.350 --> 00:07:17.630
I have over here, another art board with
character formatting for you guys to see.

133
00:07:17.630 --> 00:07:20.160
So the next one, of course,
is your font size.

134
00:07:20.160 --> 00:07:22.530
What size do you want your text to be?

135
00:07:22.530 --> 00:07:28.074
So if you select it, right over here,
the two Ts, and if you hover over the icon

136
00:07:28.074 --> 00:07:33.376
next to the field, it will give you
the tool tip of what that field is doing.

137
00:07:33.376 --> 00:07:36.467
Okay, so the two Ts right here
is the text font size and

138
00:07:36.467 --> 00:07:39.120
some points, so I can make it bigger.

139
00:07:39.120 --> 00:07:41.760
I can make it smaller,
whatever size I want.

140
00:07:41.760 --> 00:07:42.770
I could actually type it in.

141
00:07:42.770 --> 00:07:44.820
You don't have to have
it in whole numbers.

142
00:07:44.820 --> 00:07:46.791
It can do decimal points.

143
00:07:46.791 --> 00:07:52.515
And that's something that if it's text and
it's a text field, you can actually just

144
00:07:52.515 --> 00:07:58.280
grab this And drag it and make it bigger
if it is created with type on a point.

145
00:07:58.280 --> 00:08:01.000
Again, once we get back to adding text,
there's two different ways.

146
00:08:01.000 --> 00:08:03.650
There's area type and point type,
and that's the one you can do.

147
00:08:03.650 --> 00:08:07.040
So you can actually size it like you
would do any type of [INAUDIBLE].

148
00:08:07.040 --> 00:08:10.950
I am holding shift by the way,
so I can keep that proportioned.

149
00:08:10.950 --> 00:08:13.084
And so you can see it's 18.96.

150
00:08:13.084 --> 00:08:16.430
To demonstrate it doesn't have
to be in whole numbers, but

151
00:08:16.430 --> 00:08:19.160
you can choose the font size from here.

152
00:08:20.620 --> 00:08:21.940
Now another one.

153
00:08:21.940 --> 00:08:23.330
Letting.

154
00:08:23.330 --> 00:08:27.210
Letting is the space
between the baselines.

155
00:08:27.210 --> 00:08:28.800
Baseline is where the text sits, remember?

156
00:08:28.800 --> 00:08:34.630
So you can see the lines of where
the text is sitting, that's the baseline.

157
00:08:34.630 --> 00:08:41.455
It's like line spacing in Word or
whatever, Word application.

158
00:08:41.455 --> 00:08:43.115
Word processing,
that's what I'm thinking of.

159
00:08:43.115 --> 00:08:46.005
So the leading here is the space.

160
00:08:46.005 --> 00:08:47.675
It's the two A with a line on it.

161
00:08:47.675 --> 00:08:48.975
Right there, okay?

162
00:08:48.975 --> 00:08:51.985
And right now it's in parenthesis.

163
00:08:51.985 --> 00:08:54.155
It's in parenthesis that's auto leading.

164
00:08:54.155 --> 00:08:57.215
Auto leading is always,
well not always, but

165
00:08:57.215 --> 00:09:01.285
if you don't change the preferences it's
always a 120% of your font, font size.

166
00:09:01.285 --> 00:09:02.065
Okay?

167
00:09:02.065 --> 00:09:08.640
That's what it means by
leading size in parentheses.

168
00:09:08.640 --> 00:09:13.310
So if I bump this up,
you can see that it starts to increase

169
00:09:13.310 --> 00:09:18.090
the space between each line of text and
it's great.

170
00:09:18.090 --> 00:09:20.200
Now why would you want to add it for
readability?

171
00:09:20.200 --> 00:09:22.000
For stylistic purposes?

172
00:09:22.000 --> 00:09:25.641
You ever had a book where it
was almost like a hard read?

173
00:09:25.641 --> 00:09:26.581
>> It was difficult to read,

174
00:09:26.581 --> 00:09:28.729
because it just seems like a lot
of work to actually read it.

175
00:09:28.729 --> 00:09:31.471
>> Yeah, there's a whole like science or

176
00:09:31.471 --> 00:09:35.871
art to like what your body text in
a book looks like on your eyes,

177
00:09:35.871 --> 00:09:39.800
and how it's easier on your brain or
hard on your brain.

178
00:09:39.800 --> 00:09:43.650
You probably seen it you’ve seen books
Are spaced out a lot easier to read, and

179
00:09:43.650 --> 00:09:45.950
you use that serif font to
have your eye travel across,

180
00:09:45.950 --> 00:09:49.290
so it's something to think about.

181
00:09:49.290 --> 00:09:53.360
So if I bump this down I make the letting
really smaller than the font size,

182
00:09:53.360 --> 00:09:58.290
it just starts to really get squashed,
and it’s harder to read, okay?

183
00:09:58.290 --> 00:10:01.740
Yeah, that maybe, whoops, I'm hitting the
wrong button, that's why it's not working.

184
00:10:01.740 --> 00:10:04.102
So, you can see increase [INAUDIBLE].

185
00:10:04.102 --> 00:10:06.940
Now, letting is not the space
between the paragraphs.

186
00:10:06.940 --> 00:10:09.640
That's a paragraph level formatting.

00:27:59.400 --> 00:28:03.090

they're separate.

00:28:03.090 --> 00:28:08.750
Your character styles will only
hold character level formatting and

548
00:28:08.750 --> 00:28:11.620
you apply it to individual words.

549
00:28:11.620 --> 00:28:18.790
Your paragraph styles will hold if
you want to say your paragraph level

00:28:18.790 --> 00:28:22.930
formatting, and your character formatting,
you can kinda combine them all into one.

00:28:22.930 --> 00:28:25.200

00:28:25.200 --> 00:28:28.510
it's going to be ten points,

00:28:28.510 --> 00:28:32.745

00:28:32.745 --> 00:28:35.795

00:28:35.795 --> 00:28:39.785

00:28:39.785 --> 00:28:44.125

00:28:44.125 --> 00:28:47.750

00:28:47.750 --> 00:28:54.850

00:28:54.850 --> 00:28:59.430
So, in character format,

00:28:59.430 --> 00:29:03.290
paragraph cuz it's closer

00:29:03.290 --> 00:29:07.970
That's how I explain character

you can get to the same place,

00:33:45.700 --> 00:33:47.950
just where you're gonna start with it,
which is fantastic.

649
00:33:47.950 --> 00:33:51.500
And then one last thing to really
demonstrate why I'm doing styles.

650
00:33:51.500 --> 00:33:53.970
Because I have a style,
I've applied it to some things.

651
00:33:53.970 --> 00:33:57.370
But now I come back later and
I realize, you know what,

652
00:33:57.370 --> 00:34:01.200
I don't like that color red, and I've
applied it in a whole bunch of places.

653
00:34:01.200 --> 00:34:07.400
Or maybe that body text style that I made,
I want it to have more letting, right?

654
00:34:07.400 --> 00:34:09.000
It's connected to a style,
you change the style,

655
00:34:09.000 --> 00:34:12.040
it changes everywhere,
that's the fantastic part about it.

656
00:34:12.040 --> 00:34:13.825
So I don't have anything selected,

657
00:34:13.825 --> 00:34:16.192
I'm gonna come over here
to my character style.

658
00:34:16.192 --> 00:34:19.256
And I'm gonna double click, not on
the words, because if you double click on

659
00:34:19.256 --> 00:34:21.775
the words it wants to rename it,
so go a little bit to the right.

660
00:34:21.775 --> 00:34:24.668
And I'm gonna come over here
to my character color and

661
00:34:24.668 --> 00:34:28.413
even though I know it says red,
we'll go with magenta, there we go.

662
00:34:28.413 --> 00:34:31.570
Okay, it's reddish,
you can see that look at all that.

663
00:34:31.570 --> 00:34:37.370
All the places where I had that red
character style is going to be changed,

664
00:34:37.370 --> 00:34:38.500
it's pretty awesome.

665
00:34:38.500 --> 00:34:41.480
Let's just go really quickly
on the paragraph styles.

666
00:34:41.480 --> 00:34:47.780
Maybe I'll make it to have 18 pt
letting and then everything changes.

667
00:34:47.780 --> 00:34:51.877
Everywhere that style is, it's gonna go,
it's pretty awesome, I love styles.

668
00:34:51.877 --> 00:34:55.049
>> So when you apply that style that
actually stays linked to the style, and

669
00:34:55.049 --> 00:34:57.315
then you can just make
a change to the style itself.

670
00:34:57.315 --> 00:35:01.400
>> Mm-hm, and that's where, if you have
a 200 page book, that's where you want it.

671
00:35:01.400 --> 00:35:04.285
Now, you're not gonna design 200
page books in Illustrator, but.

672
00:35:04.285 --> 00:35:10.530
[LAUGH] If I'm doing extensive text
formatting, I will usually use InDesign.

673
00:35:10.530 --> 00:35:13.110
Because it's just a little more seamless,
like I said.

674
00:35:13.110 --> 00:35:14.770
But I use Illustrator all the time, and

675
00:35:14.770 --> 00:35:20.100
I use styles, and it's there,
just got to know the pitfalls.

676
00:35:20.100 --> 00:35:23.410
>> Very good, Vaughn, all right, a lot
of great stuff there about formatting.

677
00:35:23.410 --> 00:35:24.940
Looking at the character formatting,

678
00:35:24.940 --> 00:35:29.670
the individual letters or characters
as well as that paragraph formatting.

679
00:35:29.670 --> 00:35:32.440
We thank you for that,
appreciate those fantastic demos.

680
00:35:32.440 --> 00:35:35.670
Hope everyone out there enjoyed watching,
signing off for IT ProTv,

681
00:35:35.670 --> 00:35:36.990
I'm Mike Roderick.

682
00:35:36.990 --> 00:35:37.590
>> I'm Vaughn Smith.

683
00:35:37.590 --> 00:35:39.187
>> And we'll see you next time.

684
00:35:39.187 --> 00:35:47.290
[MUSIC]

episodes.title: OpenType Font Formatting

WEBVTT

1
00:00:03.630 --> 00:00:13.250
Hello, welcome to another exciting
episode here at ITPro TV.

2
00:00:15.790 --> 00:00:19.380
I'm your host Mike Rodrick, and today
we're doing Adobe Illustrator CC 2015,

3
00:00:19.380 --> 00:00:24.000
and, specifically in this episode,
we're gonna be looking at formatting.

4
00:00:24.000 --> 00:00:26.761
Now, we've already taken a look
at character formatting and

5
00:00:26.761 --> 00:00:32.040
paragraph formatting, now, we're gonna
be looking at OpenType font formatting.

6
00:00:32.040 --> 00:00:33.180
Who knew?

7
00:00:33.180 --> 00:00:35.390
I'll tell you who did, Miss Vonne Smith.

8
00:00:35.390 --> 00:00:36.320
How are you Vonne?

9
00:00:36.320 --> 00:00:40.050
>> I'm good.
Glad to be back to explain to you ,what

10
00:00:40.050 --> 00:00:42.010
open type font formatting is all about.

11
00:00:42.010 --> 00:00:45.990
So like he was saying, we have gone
over the character formatting and

12
00:00:45.990 --> 00:00:47.250
the paragraph formatting.

13
00:00:47.250 --> 00:00:49.370
Some other lessons or episodes, and

14
00:00:49.370 --> 00:00:53.610
we spent a lot of time in
the topography theory.

15
00:00:53.610 --> 00:00:57.600
Episode talking about the characteristics
of an OpenType font and

16

we went over the ligatures and
the swatches, and all that fun stuff.

17
00:01:01.150 --> 00:01:05.410
So I wanted to dedicate this episode
to showing you how and where,

18
00:01:05.410 --> 00:01:08.900
you can actually do that
formatting in Illustrator.

19
00:01:08.900 --> 00:01:11.480
So, let's just go ahead and get started.

I have the topography file
that I was working from when

we were doing our demonstrations of what

we need to find that because you

L together and that ST, unless you've

24
00:01:29.450 --> 00:01:31.880
>> Yeah, no I looked on my keyboard,
it's not there.

00:01:31.880 --> 00:01:34.240
And I can tell you as well that,
hitting the F and

does not give you your expected result.

27
00:01:37.370 --> 00:01:39.130
So hopefully, you can help me with that.

28
00:01:39.130 --> 00:01:41.450
>> Yeah,
probably is not gonna do very well.

29
00:01:41.450 --> 00:01:44.080
Might make you kind of angry,
make some weird noises happening.

30
00:01:44.080 --> 00:01:45.250
>> Yeah, it started beeping funny.

31
00:01:45.250 --> 00:01:45.785
>> Yeah.

32
00:01:45.785 --> 00:01:46.718
[LAUGH].

33
00:01:46.718 --> 00:01:51.309
Yeah, exactly,
cuz when we have these characters,

we can't type them in, so
where are we gonna find them?

00:01:55.510 --> 00:01:57.260
So let me show you the panels,

We're gonna go to our Window

We're gonna go into the Type section and

The other one we're going

42
00:02:17.890 --> 00:02:25.528
>> A glyph is a hieroglyphical

43
00:02:25.528 --> 00:02:29.865
[LAUGH] I know there was the hi,

44
00:02:29.865 --> 00:02:30.815
Hieroglyphs?

45
00:02:30.815 --> 00:02:32.430
>> Yes.
>> Hieroglyphical [CROSSTALK]

46
00:02:32.430 --> 00:02:34.096
>> Yes, there you go.

47
00:02:34.096 --> 00:02:35.810
The cave painting stuff, right?

48
00:02:35.810 --> 00:02:36.510
>> Yes.
>> Yeah, [LAUGH] that's what I was

49
00:02:36.510 --> 00:02:37.750
saying about, right?

50
00:02:37.750 --> 00:02:41.470
Egyptian hiero, heiro, I'm not gonna be

51
00:02:41.470 --> 00:02:42.651
So-
>> [LAUGH]

52
00:02:42.651 --> 00:02:44.691

it's more than just our regular

Those ones beyond it.

Like the degree sign, that's one that

That's not a key, so where do I find it?

That's in the Glyphs panel.

And it has all of the extended items in

60
00:03:11.260 --> 00:03:12.790
>> Right,
cuz we learn that in our typography,

where these open types have a lot more

00:03:18.231 --> 00:03:21.650

00:03:21.650 --> 00:03:23.610
>> All right, so

So right here, we'll start with

In this one, these are two characters,

And you can actually see while I'm

And this,there's like there's codes so

that kinda goes back to.

Something your probably know

it kind of all builds upon this,

77
00:04:06.040 --> 00:04:09.550
because that's what computers do,
is they build upon where they came from.

78
00:04:09.550 --> 00:04:13.970
So, we've got specific codes, and

00:04:13.970 --> 00:04:16.660
this is actually showing you

00:04:16.660 --> 00:04:19.040
you can see up at the top

00:04:19.040 --> 00:04:21.830
I don't know if it'll, no I didn't

but you can see at the top it

00:04:25.398 --> 00:04:26.040
It's showing
>> Mm-hm.

>> you that this is what they're

Another place that you can see that

See it's like press down,

See here,

None of the little buttons are on and

So I can change that if I wanted

This is just one way to do it so

Now that doesn't mean every character

Every font has different

Even if it's an open type font but

And you can see here, on this SWASHES,

You can see none of these options

00:06:54.210 --> 00:06:57.960
There is no A swash for
this particular font,

00:06:57.960 --> 00:07:03.285
so just because it can doesn't mean it

127
00:07:03.285 --> 00:07:04.510
>> [INAUDIBLE]
>> All right, so

again back here there's that b and

130

So that's how I made all of these

I type in the 1st and then I just

00:07:22.220 --> 00:07:26.000
I just turn this one on to say,
turn on the ordinal for this one.

133
00:07:26.000 --> 00:07:26.653
Okay.
But again,

134
00:07:26.653 --> 00:07:28.445
had to have the font that would allow for

135
00:07:28.445 --> 00:07:31.582
And so,
that's basically how it works, okay.

00:07:31.582 --> 00:07:34.620
You just format it when you want it to,

00:07:34.620 --> 00:07:38.600

138

Now, with the ornaments, that's not

[LAUGH]

00:07:48.580 --> 00:07:51.475
>> Again, it's another one of those,

144
00:07:51.475 --> 00:07:52.876
For the floopy thing.

145
00:07:52.876 --> 00:07:54.550
>> Mm-hm.
>> So I can't type it in and

147
00:07:56.357 --> 00:07:57.970
>> [LAUGH]
>> Right?

148
00:07:57.970 --> 00:07:59.299

Yeah. So. [LAUGH] So if I go.

I'm just gonna show you really quickly.

00:08:02.580 --> 00:08:05.800
I'm just gonna grab the T tool and

Ninety one and I wanna out degrees.

00:08:11.310 --> 00:08:13.200
I need to put the degree sign in there.

00:08:13.200 --> 00:08:15.220
So, I don't know where to go.

All right, well that's where

I can actually insert in the glyphs

00:08:27.640 --> 00:08:29.390

I was just showing you the first

Now, it's like no,

162
00:08:36.530 --> 00:08:38.410
I think it's that one, is that the one?

And all I gotta do is just double click,

00:08:48.990 --> 00:08:50.700
So now it's 91 degrees.

166
00:08:50.700 --> 00:08:51.490
>> Very cool.

167
00:08:51.490 --> 00:08:56.080
>> Or if I wanted to say you know,
64 cents or whatever.

00:08:56.080 --> 00:08:58.200
I think there's a cents

169
00:08:58.200 --> 00:08:59.810
So There it is.

170
00:08:59.810 --> 00:09:00.670
There's one.

00:09:00.670 --> 00:09:03.170
So, so
you can do all kinds of those things

172
00:09:03.170 --> 00:09:03.790

00:09:03.790 --> 00:09:04.770
>> Yeah, sorry, sorry.

174
00:09:04.770 --> 00:09:05.570
So you can.
Oops.

175
00:09:05.570 --> 00:09:07.914
Sorry using my wrong keyboard

00:09:08.439 --> 00:09:12.830
>> So you could just type it in 91 and

I actually just knew it was

Pro had some fancy ones in here.

188
00:09:44.745 --> 00:09:48.800
So I can switch fonts and
go down, there's some ones.

189
00:09:48.800 --> 00:09:51.372
Let's put put a little moon in there so
there you go.

190
00:09:51.372 --> 00:09:53.315
>> Nice.
>> It's 91 degrees at night,

191
00:09:53.315 --> 00:09:56.809
which is about right for Florida
>> that's a typical Florida summer evening

192
00:09:56.809 --> 00:10:00.915
>> Exactly, right, all right perfect, so

193
00:10:00.915 --> 00:10:05.965
just to continue on, just a few other
little things is dealing with numbers

194
00:10:05.965 --> 00:10:09.895
okay and fractions are the same thing
as like just coming up here and

195
00:10:09.895 --> 00:10:12.620
clicking on the open type font
to go ahead and convert it.

196
00:10:12.620 --> 00:10:15.040
Or finding that particular
glyph in the glyphs panel and

197
00:10:15.040 --> 00:10:17.780
then inserting it like you would a text.

198
00:10:17.780 --> 00:10:21.280
But how it treats your numbers,
this is a little bit different.

199
00:10:21.280 --> 00:10:25.610
So you can see that here,
in the open type panel,

200
00:10:25.610 --> 00:10:30.440
when I have this set of numbers selected
the default, it's showing you right here

201
00:10:30.440 --> 00:10:35.750
in the figure cuz these are figures,
not just alpha characters.

202
00:10:35.750 --> 00:10:37.940
So it's saying it's a default figure.

203
00:10:37.940 --> 00:10:40.800
If I click on this one,
you can see that this one says,

204
00:10:40.800 --> 00:10:43.080
it is a proportional lining.

205
00:10:43.080 --> 00:10:46.390
This one's too is a tabular lining.

206
00:10:46.390 --> 00:10:49.710
So I actually just took this first one,
duplicated it, and then just

207
00:10:49.710 --> 00:10:54.620
change the type of figure configuration
>> Using the drop down list on the panel.

208
00:10:54.620 --> 00:10:56.950
>> Exactly, and so
>> So I just, I could take here.

209
00:10:56.950 --> 00:10:58.260
And I could change it.

210
00:10:58.260 --> 00:11:00.470
And I could go to the tabular lining.

211
00:11:00.470 --> 00:11:01.340
Well, wait.
Here, let's go.

212
00:11:01.340 --> 00:11:03.885
It's proportional, and
you can see how it's actually changing.

213
00:11:03.885 --> 00:11:04.920
>> Mm-hm.

214
00:11:04.920 --> 00:11:06.350
>> The formatting of my numbers.

215
00:11:06.350 --> 00:11:09.390
Same thing with the old style figures,

216
00:11:09.390 --> 00:11:11.680
to make those numbers that
look like the houses.

217
00:11:11.680 --> 00:11:12.795
The numbers on the houses.

218
00:11:12.795 --> 00:11:13.330
>> Mm-hm.
>> Or whatever.

219
00:11:13.330 --> 00:11:16.240
So I took the default, and
then I went into proportional.

220
00:11:16.240 --> 00:11:21.230
Old style or the tabular old style rather,
here as how i

221
00:11:21.230 --> 00:11:26.190
wanted to just kind of fancy it up or
gussy up this text

222
00:11:26.190 --> 00:11:29.423
a little bit as my dad would always say
>> [LAUGH]

223
00:11:29.423 --> 00:11:30.700
>> Gussy it up [LAUGH] So,

224
00:11:30.700 --> 00:11:36.300
that is really about it that I wanted
to cover on open type font formatting.

225
00:11:36.300 --> 00:11:39.960
And the Glyphs panel and open type panel
so that you know where it is at and

226
00:11:39.960 --> 00:11:41.330
how to work with it.

227
00:11:41.330 --> 00:11:43.810
You don't ever have to use this stuff.

228
00:11:43.810 --> 00:11:46.230
Again, it's really personal opinion.

229
00:11:46.230 --> 00:11:50.700
It's that extra little oomph that
if you wanted to give your font for

230
00:11:50.700 --> 00:11:55.920
whatever which reason,
it is there if you pick the right font.

231
00:11:55.920 --> 00:11:58.830
>> It does seem like there is
a little bit of extra work involved.

232
00:11:58.830 --> 00:12:03.072
I know I've seen some books to where
like the first letter will have

233
00:12:03.072 --> 00:12:06.760
the swash of the page or
of that chapter, but nothing else.

234
00:12:06.760 --> 00:12:10.810
And maybe this explains, why it's not
as easy as just typing on the keyboard.

235
00:12:10.810 --> 00:12:13.230
>> Yeah, it does involve more work.

236
00:12:14.462 --> 00:12:18.700
It really, if a work lends itself
to having that, that's great.

237
00:12:18.700 --> 00:12:23.930
If you're just writing up a flyer that's
going to go for just informational

238
00:12:23.930 --> 00:12:28.720
purposes, you probably don't want to get
too fancy, but it's there if you want to.

239
00:12:28.720 --> 00:12:31.150
>> Very, very cool stuff,
we appreciate that.

240
00:12:31.150 --> 00:12:34.290
Now, we all know about
open type font formatting.

241
00:12:34.290 --> 00:12:34.930
We thank you for that,

242
00:12:34.930 --> 00:12:38.050
those great demonstrations,
hope everybody enjoyed watching.

243
00:12:38.050 --> 00:12:40.300
Signing off for IT ProTv,
I'm Mike Roderick.

244
00:12:40.300 --> 00:12:41.170
>> And I'm Vonne Smith.

245
00:12:41.170 --> 00:12:42.643
>> And we'll see you, next time.

246
00:12:42.643 --> 00:12:50.434
[SOUND]

episodes.title: Adding Text
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.098 --> 00:00:15.732
Hello, welcome to another exciting
episode, here at ITPro.TV.

3
00:00:15.732 --> 00:00:19.551
I'm your host Mike Rodrick and today,
we're doing Adobe Illustrator CC 2015.

4
00:00:19.551 --> 00:00:24.540
And specifically in this episode,
we're gonna be looking at adding text.

5
00:00:24.540 --> 00:00:27.510
We've gotta be able to get that
text into our document, so

6
00:00:27.510 --> 00:00:29.780
we can apply some of
that fancy formatting and

7
00:00:29.780 --> 00:00:32.870
all the other stuff that we've
learned about and are going to learn.

8
00:00:32.870 --> 00:00:34.820
And here to help us with
that is Miss Vaughn Smith.

9
00:00:34.820 --> 00:00:35.770
How are you doing Vaughn?

10
00:00:35.770 --> 00:00:36.510
>> Great.

11
00:00:36.510 --> 00:00:38.730
Ready to add text to our document.

12
00:00:38.730 --> 00:00:43.400
Because if we're going to be saying
something, we probably need some words.

13
00:00:43.400 --> 00:00:47.370
Well, I guess we could use some pictures
because pictures can have just as much

14
00:00:47.370 --> 00:00:50.040
impact of what we're
trying to communicate.

15
00:00:50.040 --> 00:00:53.163
But.
>> We've got a thousand words.

16
00:00:53.163 --> 00:00:56.780
>> [LAUGH] Yes, they do, or just one word.

17
00:00:56.780 --> 00:00:57.550
>> Or just one.

18
00:00:57.550 --> 00:01:01.250
>> Yes, but this is not an episode about
images, it's an episode about text.

19
00:01:01.250 --> 00:01:01.750
>> Okay.
>> So.

20
00:01:01.750 --> 00:01:02.321
>> Get back to it then.

21
00:01:02.321 --> 00:01:04.364
>> So we're actually going to use our

22
00:01:04.364 --> 00:01:09.004
words to communicate what we wanna say.
[LAUGH] So,

23
00:01:09.004 --> 00:01:11.490
there's quite a few ways that we
can add text into a document, so

24
00:01:11.490 --> 00:01:15.570
I'm gonna walk you through that and
go through some other ways that we can

25
00:01:15.570 --> 00:01:20.480
just do some formatting besides
just the font and other things.

26
00:01:20.480 --> 00:01:23.870
So, let's just jump right in so
I can get rolling on this.

27
00:01:23.870 --> 00:01:25.460
All right so adding text.

28
00:01:25.460 --> 00:01:27.620
And by the way, this is just a brand
new document that I created.

29
00:01:27.620 --> 00:01:30.420
It's in the Print mode so
it's in the CMYK.

30
00:01:30.420 --> 00:01:32.240
I just wanted a piece of paper, basically.

31
00:01:32.240 --> 00:01:34.620
Take out a piece of paper so
I can write on it.

32
00:01:34.620 --> 00:01:35.380
All right.

33
00:01:35.380 --> 00:01:39.830
So if we're gonna add text, we're gonna
go to the T tool or the Type tool.

34
00:01:39.830 --> 00:01:41.340
Hotkey is T.

35
00:01:41.340 --> 00:01:44.670
And just to show you,
there is a group of text tools in here.

36
00:01:44.670 --> 00:01:47.880
I can pull off the tear-off if we want to.

37
00:01:47.880 --> 00:01:49.600
Do I use every single one of these?

38
00:01:49.600 --> 00:01:53.490
Not necessarily because I don't have
to use every single one of them.

39
00:01:53.490 --> 00:01:55.680
But the T tool is your main one.

40
00:01:55.680 --> 00:01:59.550
Okay, so you get your cursor ready to go.

41
00:01:59.550 --> 00:02:02.130
Now there's two ways that
you can use the type tool.

42
00:02:02.130 --> 00:02:08.610
You can type at a point, or what they
call point type, or you can do area type.

43
00:02:08.610 --> 00:02:09.850
Let me explain what that means.

44
00:02:09.850 --> 00:02:11.560
All right.
So I'm just gonna zoom in.

45
00:02:11.560 --> 00:02:15.580
Type at a point, or a point type, is where
you just take the T tool and just click.

46
00:02:15.580 --> 00:02:17.830
You just click and say I wanna add text.

47
00:02:17.830 --> 00:02:19.290
So you just Single click and

48
00:02:19.290 --> 00:02:23.740
there's my flashing cursor and
I say like, hello world.

49
00:02:23.740 --> 00:02:27.491
Whoops, hello world, wow okay [LAUGH].

50
00:02:27.491 --> 00:02:31.510
>> [LAUGH]
>> Let's not judge me on how I can type.

51
00:02:31.510 --> 00:02:33.840
All right so here I go, hello world.

52
00:02:33.840 --> 00:02:34.740
That's it.

53
00:02:34.740 --> 00:02:38.870
When I'm done I go back to the black
arrow tool to go ahead to complete that.

54
00:02:38.870 --> 00:02:41.740
Because that's one thing that when you're
in the T tool when you're trying to

55
00:02:41.740 --> 00:02:46.640
click off of this like you would in a
regular like selecting items or something.

56
00:02:46.640 --> 00:02:47.930
You don't have the black arrow tool.

57
00:02:47.930 --> 00:02:49.380
You've always gotta be careful about that.

58
00:02:49.380 --> 00:02:51.630
It's like I'm going back
to the black arrow tool.

59
00:02:51.630 --> 00:02:54.990
>> Because you've clicked somewhere
else it gonna create another type point?

60
00:02:54.990 --> 00:02:55.940
>> Correct, yes.

61
00:02:55.940 --> 00:02:59.700
Or it's really just, I can't get
out of where you're at right now so

62
00:02:59.700 --> 00:03:01.160
I don't know what you want me to do.

63
00:03:01.160 --> 00:03:04.120
So it's either one or the other basically.

64
00:03:04.120 --> 00:03:05.730
>> Could you bump that
font just a wee bit?

65
00:03:05.730 --> 00:03:09.490
I know it's not important what you're
typing but it's so small, my eyes are old.

66
00:03:09.490 --> 00:03:10.190
>> How about that?

67
00:03:10.190 --> 00:03:10.874
Is that better for you?

68
00:03:10.874 --> 00:03:14.110
[LAUGH] All right, so I've already
gone back into the black area so

69
00:03:14.110 --> 00:03:20.360
now I have this Text box selected,
so what can I do with it?

70
00:03:20.360 --> 00:03:25.100
Now, type on a point is where you can
kinda treat it like a regular object,

71
00:03:25.100 --> 00:03:27.890
in a sense I wanna make this bigger or
I wanna make it smaller.

72
00:03:27.890 --> 00:03:31.030
You just take the corner,
and I'm gonna hold my Shift

73
00:03:31.030 --> 00:03:34.440
key to constrain my proportions, and
I'm gonna click hold and drag, and

74
00:03:34.440 --> 00:03:38.420
I just make this bigger, because maybe
I'm making a headline in my document.

75
00:03:38.420 --> 00:03:41.820
I'm like, okay that's how big
I want it to be, that's fine.

76
00:03:42.920 --> 00:03:44.900
But you also can stretch it.

77
00:03:44.900 --> 00:03:47.340
You can extend it out and
that's where we're doing

78
00:03:49.080 --> 00:03:53.385
the scaling in the character
form out sorry character panel.

79
00:03:53.385 --> 00:03:55.725
Let me go ahead and
pull that up since we're talking about it.

80
00:03:57.015 --> 00:03:58.805
So you can see.

81
00:03:58.805 --> 00:04:00.625
>> Yes the horizontal and
the vertical scaling.

82
00:04:00.625 --> 00:04:02.115
We can type a number in there.

83
00:04:02.115 --> 00:04:05.960
>> Exactly yeah because I was going
backwards in how I teach this.

84
00:04:05.960 --> 00:04:07.690
Maybe you're watching this first.

85
00:04:07.690 --> 00:04:10.290
I was showing you all the different
ways you can format first and

86
00:04:10.290 --> 00:04:13.530
then how to add it because I
just like to do it that way.

87
00:04:13.530 --> 00:04:15.930
So you can see that
the scaling has changed.

88
00:04:15.930 --> 00:04:19.780
And so if I change this it's going to
squash this and it's going to scrunch it.

89
00:04:19.780 --> 00:04:25.360
And it's going to treat it just
like it would if it was a square or

90
00:04:25.360 --> 00:04:28.040
an object, it's still text,
but it acts like that.

91
00:04:28.040 --> 00:04:30.610
So that's type on a point.

92
00:04:30.610 --> 00:04:31.510
Okay, you just click and type.

93
00:04:32.630 --> 00:04:34.340
So I'm gonna go back to the T tool.

94
00:04:34.340 --> 00:04:38.110
And I'm gonna do one more thing with that
type on a point just to show you if I say,

95
00:04:39.590 --> 00:04:44.130
one and then enter,
two enter, three enter.

96
00:04:44.130 --> 00:04:49.500
You can create your own paragraphs
by hitting the enter key, okay,

97
00:04:49.500 --> 00:04:52.465
and that's fine but
it's still type on a point.

98
00:04:52.465 --> 00:04:56.300
It's still gonna stretch,
if you change the size of the text frame.

99
00:04:56.300 --> 00:04:58.480
>> And even though you hit
enter a couple of times there,

100
00:04:58.480 --> 00:05:00.830
it's still a single object.

101
00:05:00.830 --> 00:05:06.380
>> Yes, yes, it is paragraphs within
that text frame, if you want to call it.

102
00:05:06.380 --> 00:05:08.070
>> Okay.
>> So now let me go to the other way

103
00:05:08.070 --> 00:05:08.570
you could do this.

104
00:05:08.570 --> 00:05:09.740
This is area type.

105
00:05:10.970 --> 00:05:12.280
Well, it's just area type.

106
00:05:12.280 --> 00:05:15.960
So I'm gonna take the T tool, and
I'm gonna click, hold, and drag.

107
00:05:15.960 --> 00:05:17.930
And create a text frame first.

108
00:05:17.930 --> 00:05:20.660
And this is the way you have
to do this in enDesign.

109
00:05:20.660 --> 00:05:23.310
You always have to draw a frame
before you can type anything in.

110
00:05:23.310 --> 00:05:25.640
So if you're coming
over from that program,

111
00:05:25.640 --> 00:05:28.840
that's probably the way you're
used to doing it, okay?

112
00:05:28.840 --> 00:05:35.790
So if I then click, hold and drag and
I type in Hello World, okay there's that.

113
00:05:35.790 --> 00:05:39.340
And if I take the black arrow tool and
I start changing this text frame.

114
00:05:39.340 --> 00:05:42.100
You see how it doesn't matter if I'm
changing the size of the text frame,

115
00:05:42.100 --> 00:05:48.410
it's not changing the size of the text
because it's just changing the frame.

116
00:05:48.410 --> 00:05:49.620
That's all it is.

117
00:05:49.620 --> 00:05:53.150
Now, how that can be beneficial
is if I take this and

118
00:05:53.150 --> 00:05:57.090
I wanted to start putting
this down on another line.

119
00:05:57.090 --> 00:06:01.870
It's the words are going to start
wrapping within the text frame.

120
00:06:01.870 --> 00:06:07.800
Okay so, if I kinda come back here and
just say this is some more text.

121
00:06:07.800 --> 00:06:11.430
Whoops some, here's some more text.

122
00:06:11.430 --> 00:06:12.150
I'm just gonna go ahead and

123
00:06:12.150 --> 00:06:16.160
type like this because [LAUGH] I'm
not doing a very good job of typing.

124
00:06:16.160 --> 00:06:19.250
So you can see if I take this and
start changing the size,

125
00:06:19.250 --> 00:06:23.180
the text frame is going to change
the way the text wraps in the frame.

126
00:06:23.180 --> 00:06:27.962
That's way it's a little bit easier
maybe to demonstrate there with

127
00:06:27.962 --> 00:06:30.693
a little bit more words then just that.

128
00:06:30.693 --> 00:06:35.519
So that's difference click and
type, or click, hold and drag and

129
00:06:35.519 --> 00:06:40.258
then type, point or aerial type,
all right and I actually lost my

130
00:06:40.258 --> 00:06:45.714
character panel when I was doing some
weird keyboard thing, right there.

131
00:06:45.714 --> 00:06:47.300
So those are the two main
ways you could do it.

132
00:06:47.300 --> 00:06:51.310
Now the cool thing about the newer
version of Illustrator and

133
00:06:51.310 --> 00:06:55.320
I can't remember exactly when they
started this is that you can switch

134
00:06:55.320 --> 00:06:59.170
in between those two types of
text frames that you can have.

135
00:06:59.170 --> 00:07:02.140
The point type or
the area point, which was huge.

136
00:07:02.140 --> 00:07:04.420
When they added this I was very,
very happy.

137
00:07:04.420 --> 00:07:08.850
Because otherwise you would of had to,
if I wanted this to become area type,

138
00:07:08.850 --> 00:07:12.830
I would have to select it, cut it out,
make a new text frame, put it back in, and

139
00:07:12.830 --> 00:07:13.630
vice versa.

140
00:07:13.630 --> 00:07:17.430
So it was kind of not very
easy to switch back and forth.

141
00:07:17.430 --> 00:07:20.125
Permit not being what it was.

142
00:07:20.125 --> 00:07:24.740
[LAUGH] So now,
you have the very end of a text frame.

143
00:07:24.740 --> 00:07:29.470
You have this little on the right hand
side, this little circle-y handle thing.

144
00:07:29.470 --> 00:07:30.310
Okay.

145
00:07:30.310 --> 00:07:33.645
This is if when I click on it,
okay, it's going to.

146
00:07:33.645 --> 00:07:35.055
Here let me move this.

147
00:07:35.055 --> 00:07:38.045
It actually says, I'm single clicking
just to show you that it is saying,

148
00:07:38.045 --> 00:07:40.195
double click to convert to area type.

149
00:07:41.275 --> 00:07:44.860
As opposed to if I had this one,
see over here.

150
00:07:44.860 --> 00:07:49.800
If I single click on it,
it's going to say,

151
00:07:49.800 --> 00:07:54.213
double click to convert to point type.

152
00:07:54.213 --> 00:07:56.758
So, it's allowing me to switch back and
forth.

153
00:07:56.758 --> 00:07:57.780
Huge addition.

154
00:07:57.780 --> 00:07:59.138
>> Wow.
>> Yeah, major for me.

155
00:07:59.138 --> 00:08:01.332
So, if I then double click on this.

156
00:08:01.332 --> 00:08:05.631
Now this has now become a area type, and

157
00:08:05.631 --> 00:08:12.050
if I double click it again
then it will okay yes I know.

158
00:08:12.050 --> 00:08:15.820
It gave me a warning, I didn't explain to
you what it was cuz I wasn't ready to show

159
00:08:15.820 --> 00:08:18.500
you that just yet, so I wasn't trying to-
>> We'll come back to that.

160
00:08:18.500 --> 00:08:22.880
>> Yeah I wasn't trying to skip over that,
but it will go ahead and

161
00:08:22.880 --> 00:08:24.310
convert back and forth.

162
00:08:24.310 --> 00:08:25.190
Very, very handy.

163
00:08:25.190 --> 00:08:26.640
>> I can see where that
would really be convenient.

164
00:08:26.640 --> 00:08:30.860
You might wanna stretch that text out so
you convert it to that point type.

165
00:08:30.860 --> 00:08:34.390
Stretch it out real quick, and then
convert it right back to an area type.

166
00:08:34.390 --> 00:08:37.170
So that you can change
the size of the column or

167
00:08:37.170 --> 00:08:38.330
whatever you might be trying to do.

168
00:08:38.330 --> 00:08:39.490
>> Yeah, exactly.

169
00:08:39.490 --> 00:08:43.755
And I think it'll really demonstrate

So how you can do text threading,

00:20:27.530 --> 00:20:32.080
Just like when we do our images where
it's gonna show you the previews for

396
00:20:32.080 --> 00:20:33.140
the images.

397
00:20:33.140 --> 00:20:36.580
And if I click, hold, and drag, make
a big old text frame, it goes ahead and

398
00:20:36.580 --> 00:20:37.170
brings it in.

399
00:20:37.170 --> 00:20:41.330
And it looks like it does in Word.

400
00:20:41.330 --> 00:20:43.060
>> It looks exactly the same, yeah.

401
00:20:43.060 --> 00:20:43.560
>> Right, yeah.

402
00:20:43.560 --> 00:20:46.630
It brought in my text and
it brought in my colors.

403
00:20:46.630 --> 00:20:53.591
And if I go over to my character panel,
okay, I can go into, so my styles, sorry.

404
00:20:53.591 --> 00:20:56.983
It brought in the Heading 1, the Heading
2, the [INAUDIBLE], the title and

405
00:20:56.983 --> 00:20:58.050
everything like that.

406
00:20:58.050 --> 00:21:01.487
>> It does look like it brought in
Heading 1, I see the blue color there but

407
00:21:01.487 --> 00:21:03.105
the size doesn't look the same.

408
00:21:03.105 --> 00:21:06.523
And I know you had a larger, at the very
top of your document, above the red text,

409
00:21:06.523 --> 00:21:08.210
that was a little larger as well.

410
00:21:08.210 --> 00:21:08.920
>> Yeah.

411
00:21:08.920 --> 00:21:11.640
This is that weird thing that when
you place it, it doesn't really work.

412
00:21:11.640 --> 00:21:13.640
>> So it brings in part of the style but
not the entire style.

413
00:21:13.640 --> 00:21:14.390
>> Yeah, and

414
00:21:14.390 --> 00:21:18.420
sometimes it works better than others but
it's just one of those things, so.

415
00:21:18.420 --> 00:21:19.139
>> Just gotta try it and see.

416
00:21:19.139 --> 00:21:20.700
>> Yeah.
>> It's still better than

417
00:21:20.700 --> 00:21:23.110
starting from scratch, I mean you've
got the bulk of the data in there,

418
00:21:23.110 --> 00:21:25.770
your text and some of the styles.

419
00:21:25.770 --> 00:21:27.040
>> Yeah.
>> Which is good.

420
00:21:27.040 --> 00:21:31.314
>> I would normally probably just remove
everything and just format it myself,

421
00:21:31.314 --> 00:21:35.716
because I'm also wanting it to look very
different most of the time than I want it

422
00:21:35.716 --> 00:21:37.245
to look like in a Word file.

423
00:21:37.245 --> 00:21:40.620
Than something that I'm going to be
doing for branding of a company or

424
00:21:40.620 --> 00:21:41.736
something like that.

425
00:21:41.736 --> 00:21:44.440
>> Typically your source file doesn't have
the right formatting you want anyway,

426
00:21:44.440 --> 00:21:45.830
so you don't care if it strips it all out.

427
00:21:45.830 --> 00:21:46.530
>> Pretty much, yeah.

428
00:21:46.530 --> 00:21:48.760
>> Gotcha.
>> So, but if you need it, it's there.

429
00:21:48.760 --> 00:21:50.780
And like I said,
InDesign's a lot better at it.

430
00:21:50.780 --> 00:21:52.830
But right here I can show you
that if I go over to here,

431
00:21:52.830 --> 00:21:54.710
it's showing that it's Myriad.

432
00:21:54.710 --> 00:21:56.360
That's not Arial, okay?

433
00:21:56.360 --> 00:21:57.770
And yeah, the font is different.

434
00:21:57.770 --> 00:22:01.160
And that's because, remember what
we talked about with the styles,

435
00:22:01.160 --> 00:22:02.570
remember that red, the plus sign.

436
00:22:02.570 --> 00:22:05.190
>> Mm-hm.
>> Means there's overrides, okay.

437
00:22:05.190 --> 00:22:09.070
Something is making it's
overriding the initial,

438
00:22:09.070 --> 00:22:14.190
the real style underneath it, if you want
to say, to have it not really show it.

439
00:22:14.190 --> 00:22:18.470
And even if I take this and I do
the Alt+Click to remove the overrides,

440
00:22:18.470 --> 00:22:22.055
it's still showing Myriad, which I
never had Myriad in Word to begin with.

441
00:22:22.055 --> 00:22:25.320
>> [LAUGH]
>> So, at least it's trying.

442
00:22:25.320 --> 00:22:26.138
>> It is.

443
00:22:26.138 --> 00:22:29.815
>> So, it's doing its best but-
>> A for effort.

444
00:22:29.815 --> 00:22:31.580
>> [LAUGH] Definitely A for effort,

445
00:22:31.580 --> 00:22:35.150
but at least I can come into here and
just reformat.

446
00:22:35.150 --> 00:22:39.310
I could even go ahead and
use the normal paragraph style

447
00:22:39.310 --> 00:22:42.270
in Illustrator to go ahead and
get rid of everything.

448
00:22:42.270 --> 00:22:45.015
That's usually what I'll do,
bring it in and take it out,

449
00:22:45.015 --> 00:22:47.905
and then try to fix it up.

450
00:22:47.905 --> 00:22:52.175
It does bring in the color,
I wanted to point out that as well.

451
00:22:52.175 --> 00:22:56.760
Because that's something you should know,
kind of going back to that test

452
00:22:56.760 --> 00:23:00.253
question of how it's treated,
is that those swatches,

453
00:23:00.253 --> 00:23:04.790
you can see that these are the colors
that are coming in from the Word file.

454
00:23:04.790 --> 00:23:08.040
And you can see they're coming
in as global colors, okay.

455
00:23:08.040 --> 00:23:13.730
Now, these aren't all the colors that
were used in the document but it's just

456
00:23:13.730 --> 00:23:18.640
part of what Word remembers as the color
theme, and all that fun stuff that works.

457
00:23:18.640 --> 00:23:21.205
>> Exactly, that palette that
goes with that particular style.

458
00:23:21.205 --> 00:23:21.770
>> Mm-hm, yeah.

459
00:23:21.770 --> 00:23:24.390
And so it's bringing it in,
and they're global swatches.

460
00:23:24.390 --> 00:23:27.760
So again,
you could use it if you wanted to,

461
00:23:27.760 --> 00:23:30.970
to say let's change up the, all the colors
that were blue, let's go ahead and

462
00:23:30.970 --> 00:23:33.630
use that, but
I'm probably not gonna do that.

463
00:23:33.630 --> 00:23:37.340
So, I would probably take it all out and
redo it for myself, so.

464
00:23:37.340 --> 00:23:39.300
All right?

465
00:23:39.300 --> 00:23:42.930
And that's how you can add
some text in your document.

466
00:23:42.930 --> 00:23:44.560
>> Fantastic stuff, fun.

467
00:23:44.560 --> 00:23:49.115
Great look at how we can get that text
into our document, whether we're just

468
00:23:49.115 --> 00:23:53.405
starting with nothing and typing it
in with a point type or an area type.

469
00:23:53.405 --> 00:23:58.640
Or for cutting and pasting or copying,
pasting, or placing that text.

470
00:23:58.640 --> 00:24:03.290
And then remember big difference
between cut and paste versus placing.

471
00:24:03.290 --> 00:24:05.755
Make sure you guys remember that for
those exam tips.

472
00:24:05.755 --> 00:24:07.569
>> Mm-hm.
>> All right Von, we appreciate that,

473
00:24:07.569 --> 00:24:09.030
appreciate those great demos.

474
00:24:09.030 --> 00:24:10.520
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching.

475
00:24:10.520 --> 00:24:13.130
Signing off for ITProTV, I'm Mike Rodrick.

476
00:24:13.130 --> 00:24:13.720
>> And I'm Von Smith.

episodes.title: Type on a Path and Text Wrap
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.046 --> 00:00:10.046
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:11.946 --> 00:00:15.382
Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:15.382 --> 00:00:20.108
I'm your host, Mike Rodrick, and today
we're doing our Adobe Illustrator CC 2015.

4
00:00:20.108 --> 00:00:24.766
And specifically in this episode, we're
gonna be looking at type on a path and

5
00:00:24.766 --> 00:00:25.900
text wrap.

6
00:00:25.900 --> 00:00:29.858
Now we've already looked at some ways we
can insert text into our documents that

7
00:00:29.858 --> 00:00:30.815
we're creating.

8
00:00:30.815 --> 00:00:34.159
And do formatting both at
the character and the paragraph level.

9
00:00:34.159 --> 00:00:37.400
Now we're gonna take adding
text to the next level.

10
00:00:37.400 --> 00:00:38.420
And have a little fun with it.

11
00:00:38.420 --> 00:00:40.280
And here to help us with that is Ms.
Vaughan Smith.

12
00:00:40.280 --> 00:00:41.050
How are you doing, Vaughan?

13
00:00:41.050 --> 00:00:44.450
>> Great, ready to rock and
roll on some paths today.

14
00:00:44.450 --> 00:00:46.560
And go up and down, and all which ways.

15
00:00:46.560 --> 00:00:47.361
So
>> Absolutely.

16
00:00:47.361 --> 00:00:52.493
>> Yes, it's gonna be lot of fun and
I put two concepts together that

17
00:00:52.493 --> 00:00:58.290
not necessarily really go together,
but they kinda do, but not really.

18
00:00:58.290 --> 00:00:59.243
So [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

19
00:00:59.243 --> 00:01:01.289
>> We're gonna talk about how we can put

20
00:01:01.289 --> 00:01:04.467
text on a pattern,
how it almost wraps around that path.

21
00:01:04.467 --> 00:01:09.430
And then, we're gonna talk about how we
can take text and wrap it around objects.

22
00:01:09.430 --> 00:01:11.308
>> So, kinda close.

23
00:01:11.308 --> 00:01:13.853
We'll see.
>> Yeah, well, they have some similar

24
00:01:13.853 --> 00:01:18.087
words, [LAUGH] but they are all part
of having more fun with text and so

25
00:01:18.087 --> 00:01:20.555
that's what we're going to do today.

26
00:01:20.555 --> 00:01:23.915
So let's just go ahead and jump in and

27
00:01:23.915 --> 00:01:29.305
get going because I have a segment that
I have some paths already created.

28
00:01:29.305 --> 00:01:33.780
We learned how to use the pen tool and
make our cute little S curve.

29
00:01:33.780 --> 00:01:36.435
This is just the line,
this is just a circle.

30
00:01:36.435 --> 00:01:40.065
So we're going to add text around them or

31
00:01:40.065 --> 00:01:44.020
on them because maybe we don't
want to just go straight across.

32
00:01:44.020 --> 00:01:48.620
We want to follow a path and
that's what type on a path means, but

33
00:01:48.620 --> 00:01:52.490
before we get in to showing you exactly
how to do that I do wanna take this moment

34
00:01:52.490 --> 00:01:56.110
to really point out the mouse
cursor icons because

35
00:01:56.110 --> 00:01:59.920
this is where it is really
important to watch for that.

36
00:01:59.920 --> 00:02:01.130
We saw how we could add text.

37
00:02:01.130 --> 00:02:02.560
We just click and type.

38
00:02:02.560 --> 00:02:04.870
And that has the little box around it.

39
00:02:04.870 --> 00:02:06.730
And maybe I didn't point
it out as clearly.

40
00:02:06.730 --> 00:02:09.380
But here is where you're really
going to really need it.

41
00:02:09.380 --> 00:02:12.130
So I'm gonna go over here to the T tool.

42
00:02:12.130 --> 00:02:15.820
And right here, you can see that
my mouse cursor icon looks like

43
00:02:16.870 --> 00:02:19.260
a box with I beam in it.

44
00:02:19.260 --> 00:02:22.540
So there's a dotted box
around the mouse cursor.

45
00:02:22.540 --> 00:02:26.220
That indicates to you that
you are creating new text.

46
00:02:26.220 --> 00:02:29.660
That's the whole click and type or click,
hold and drag and make a text box and

47
00:02:29.660 --> 00:02:30.820
you can add text.

48
00:02:30.820 --> 00:02:32.220
That's great.

49
00:02:32.220 --> 00:02:36.310
Well when you're doing type on a path,
if you're using type on a path or

50
00:02:36.310 --> 00:02:39.790
you're actually using an open path and
wanting to add type to it,

51
00:02:39.790 --> 00:02:41.510
you're gonna get this icon,

52
00:02:41.510 --> 00:02:46.880
and you see how it actually looks like an
I-beam with like a little dotted swoopy?

53
00:02:46.880 --> 00:02:48.603
That's a technical term there.

54
00:02:48.603 --> 00:02:50.039
>> Swoopy, I like that.

55
00:02:50.039 --> 00:02:54.240
>> [LAUGH] So you have the swoopy on the
I-beam versus the box around the I-beam.

56
00:02:54.240 --> 00:02:59.470
So those are two big indications to you
that you're either adding regular type or

57
00:02:59.470 --> 00:03:04.280
it's saying that I found a path
that I'm gonna attach myself to.

58
00:03:04.280 --> 00:03:08.550
So big indications of
what you're doing here.

59
00:03:08.550 --> 00:03:12.300
Now that mouse cursor icon will
be the swoopy, the swoopy [LAUGH]

60
00:03:12.300 --> 00:03:17.220
I-beam will only be when you're adding,
or you're around open paths.

61
00:03:17.220 --> 00:03:20.480
For example this, there's this circle,
this is a closed path, right?

62
00:03:20.480 --> 00:03:23.884
If I get into here, I can come anywhere
near the edge of the circle, and

63
00:03:23.884 --> 00:03:27.620
it's not gonna give me the same
mouse cursor icon as this guy does.

64
00:03:27.620 --> 00:03:31.060
That's because it doesn't find the end.

65
00:03:31.060 --> 00:03:33.760
So it actually goes with
different mouse cursor icon.

66
00:03:33.760 --> 00:03:38.710
It goes to the I-beam with a circle around
it, and when you have a circle around

67
00:03:38.710 --> 00:03:44.960
the I-beam, it's going to be adding text
inside of that path, almost like a frame.

68
00:03:44.960 --> 00:03:50.436
It's saying I found a frame for
me to put text inside of.

69
00:03:50.436 --> 00:03:51.819
So, again, very slight but

70
00:03:51.819 --> 00:03:55.115
it makes a huge difference as to
where your text is going to be added.

71
00:03:55.115 --> 00:03:57.147
>> Absolutely.
>> Okay, there's one more and

72
00:03:57.147 --> 00:04:00.480
that's where if your over text
that is already existing.

73
00:04:00.480 --> 00:04:02.350
Like right here, I have some text.

74
00:04:02.350 --> 00:04:03.830
If I put my mouse cursor over it,

75
00:04:03.830 --> 00:04:07.820
trying to get a point where you can
probably see it, it's there's no box.

76
00:04:07.820 --> 00:04:12.170
If there's no box, it means it's
finding text that it sees, and

77
00:04:12.170 --> 00:04:16.030
if you click, it's gonna just go
into the text that's already there.

78
00:04:16.030 --> 00:04:19.598
And I actually made some little notes over
here just in case you all wanted to have

79
00:04:19.598 --> 00:04:21.260
it and then so you can have this file.

80
00:04:21.260 --> 00:04:26.087
But it just shows the different cursors
and what you can do, and it also kind of

81
00:04:26.087 --> 00:04:30.710
gives you the option of the open path and
close paths and so on and so forth.

82
00:04:30.710 --> 00:04:32.875
Because I am showing you
on the text that the oops,

83
00:04:32.875 --> 00:04:34.588
that's the wrong files covered here.

84
00:04:34.588 --> 00:04:39.980
[LAUGH] The first example that I'm
gonna show you is with an open path.

85
00:04:39.980 --> 00:04:42.620
I am just using the regular old type tool.

86
00:04:42.620 --> 00:04:46.790
But there is a type on a path tool.

87
00:04:46.790 --> 00:04:51.250
So you could use that tool, if you're
like, I know exactly what I'm going to do.

88
00:04:51.250 --> 00:04:54.030
But again, I just really
wanted to drive home the point

89
00:04:54.030 --> 00:04:57.468
about the mouse cursor icons with
the regular text tool, okay?

90
00:04:58.500 --> 00:05:00.608
Or type text, there we go.

91
00:05:00.608 --> 00:05:04.810
All right, so we've made a path and
we want the text to go along it.

92
00:05:04.810 --> 00:05:08.300
I'm finding my mouse cursor that
gives me a little swoopy, okay,

93
00:05:08.300 --> 00:05:10.990
staying consistent with my terminology.

94
00:05:10.990 --> 00:05:14.390
And all you gotta do is
just click on to that path.

95
00:05:14.390 --> 00:05:16.060
You’re saying I want to attach yourself.

96
00:05:16.060 --> 00:05:18.340
So I click and two things happen.

97
00:05:18.340 --> 00:05:21.540
The flashing mouse cursor
goes on that path and

98
00:05:21.540 --> 00:05:23.910
the formatting of your
path goes away by default.

99
00:05:23.910 --> 00:05:24.960
That will always happen.

100
00:05:24.960 --> 00:05:26.350
So you could have a fill in a stroke.

101
00:05:26.350 --> 00:05:28.810
It will always go to, no fill, no stroke.

102
00:05:29.840 --> 00:05:32.647
You can change that afterwards but
we'll get to that, okay?

103
00:05:32.647 --> 00:05:38.451
So we're just gonna go ahead and type,
we're gonna say and type on a path.

104
00:05:38.451 --> 00:05:43.121
Yay, all right, so I've got that there,
and now I can go ahead and

105
00:05:43.121 --> 00:05:48.294
select the text just like I would if I
wanted to, or I can go back to the black

106
00:05:48.294 --> 00:05:53.170
arrow to unselect the entire text
box which is on this text frame.

107
00:05:53.170 --> 00:05:54.160
And you can format everything.

108
00:05:54.160 --> 00:05:56.700
I'm just gonna make this text bigger so
we can see it a little bit better.

109
00:05:56.700 --> 00:05:59.310
So there we go,
maybe bump it up just a little bit.

110
00:05:59.310 --> 00:06:01.000
And you can see here's
this type on a path.

111
00:06:01.000 --> 00:06:01.960
So same formatting.

112
00:06:01.960 --> 00:06:02.760
You can change the color.

113
00:06:02.760 --> 00:06:03.710
Do whatever you want with it.

114
00:06:03.710 --> 00:06:04.790
That's fine.

115
00:06:04.790 --> 00:06:09.280
But this is where if I wanted to,
I like the text but

116
00:06:09.280 --> 00:06:12.090
I wanted to kinda go down
the hill a little bit, okay?

117
00:06:12.090 --> 00:06:15.264
And this is what I call you're gonna
push the train down the tracks.

118
00:06:15.264 --> 00:06:17.460
>> [LAUGH]
>> Cuz that's what it kinda just

119
00:06:17.460 --> 00:06:18.201
reminds me of.

120
00:06:18.201 --> 00:06:21.516
And this is another place where
you do need to be careful and

121
00:06:21.516 --> 00:06:24.506
watch what does your mouse
cursor look like, okay?

122
00:06:24.506 --> 00:06:27.410
And you have to be doing this
with a black arrow tool.

123
00:06:27.410 --> 00:06:29.080
You don't do this with the T tool, right?

124
00:06:29.080 --> 00:06:32.960
So, let me just show you, T tool is not
going to give you the same mouse cursor

125
00:06:32.960 --> 00:06:36.850
icons that I'm wanting to show to
push the train down the tracks.

126
00:06:36.850 --> 00:06:38.270
That's the black arrow tool.

127
00:06:38.270 --> 00:06:41.390
That's another kind of misconception
that a lot of people fall into.

128
00:06:41.390 --> 00:06:42.560
It's like, we'll type.

129
00:06:42.560 --> 00:06:46.050
>> It looks like with your text tool,
it actually turn back into the I-beam with

130
00:06:46.050 --> 00:06:50.310
no frame cuz it sees text and it's like
you're gonna add text to existing text.

131
00:06:50.310 --> 00:06:51.150
>> Exactly, yes.

132
00:06:51.150 --> 00:06:51.780
And in this plan,

133
00:06:51.780 --> 00:06:56.290
we want to move the text on the paths,
move the train down the tracks.

134
00:06:56.290 --> 00:06:57.687
So black arrow tool.

135
00:06:57.687 --> 00:07:02.551
Okay, so here you can see that you've
got this little guy right here.

136
00:07:02.551 --> 00:07:04.880
It's like a line with a little box on it.

137
00:07:04.880 --> 00:07:10.050
This is indicating to you, this is where
the train tracks start if you wanna say.

138
00:07:10.050 --> 00:07:13.600
This is like the beginning of the train,
okay?

139
00:07:13.600 --> 00:07:14.426
The text is a train.

140
00:07:14.426 --> 00:07:15.315
[LAUGH] And

141
00:07:15.315 --> 00:07:19.720
then you have the track which is the path
and then you have the end of the track.

142
00:07:19.720 --> 00:07:21.460
Okay, and that's again right there.

143
00:07:21.460 --> 00:07:23.620
So you see it's got

to be able to tell you about

00:00:43.070 --> 00:00:44.880
that tool that you keep asking me about.

13
00:00:44.880 --> 00:00:47.165

tell you until we do the episode.

14
00:00:47.165 --> 00:00:48.130
>> [LAUGH]
>> So

I'll be able to share with you this

17
00:00:55.845 --> 00:00:56.765
>> I"m looking forward to it.

18
00:00:56.765 --> 00:01:01.790
>> Good [LAUGH] all right, so
now you can add text to your document.

19
00:01:01.790 --> 00:01:06.590
And of course, any time you add text to
your document, you are using text as text.

20
00:01:06.590 --> 00:01:08.150
It's going to have a font.

21
00:01:08.150 --> 00:01:13.770
And we've talked about fonts and having
fonts in your machine and all of that kind

22
00:01:13.770 --> 00:01:17.700
of wonderful stuff in some of our previous
episodes talking about typography.

23
00:01:17.700 --> 00:01:22.690
So when you create text outlines,
you're actually removing the text.

24
00:01:22.690 --> 00:01:25.670
It's no longer text, it becomes shapes.

25
00:01:25.670 --> 00:01:29.190
And if you have shapes, you have no font,
you have no font files.

26
00:01:29.190 --> 00:01:32.502
So then you don't have to worry
about mix matched fonts or

27
00:01:32.502 --> 00:01:35.960
sending a font to a printer or
to somebody else.

28
00:01:35.960 --> 00:01:38.919
It just doesn't exist, it's shapes so-
>> Very cool.

29
00:01:38.919 --> 00:01:42.170
>> There's good things, but then there
can be some drawbacks, of course.

30
00:01:42.170 --> 00:01:46.570
Because if I'm sending you a document
that is in the final stage,

31
00:01:46.570 --> 00:01:47.850
and it's in the outlines, and

32
00:01:47.850 --> 00:01:52.670
you want to edit that text, well,
you can't, because it's not text, okay.

33
00:01:52.670 --> 00:01:55.560
So you have good points and
bad points and when and

34
00:01:55.560 --> 00:01:58.390
why you want to use outline text, so.

35
00:01:58.390 --> 00:02:00.170
It's quite easy to do.

36
00:02:00.170 --> 00:02:02.170
So let me show you, all right.

37
00:02:02.170 --> 00:02:06.220
So I've got this wonderful file,
that's Outlines, right.

38
00:02:06.220 --> 00:02:10.290
And you can even see, but
this looks like just rectangles, right.

39
00:02:10.290 --> 00:02:13.950
That's a rectangle, that's a rectangle
there, and so on and so forth.

40
00:02:13.950 --> 00:02:17.740
So right now, this is in an Arial font.

41
00:02:17.740 --> 00:02:21.340
And I just made it whatever a font size
that I wanted to make it visually.

42
00:02:21.340 --> 00:02:27.005
So if I sent this file to a printer or
to you, and you didn't have Arial.

43
00:02:27.005 --> 00:02:28.373
Now, for
you to not have Arial is pretty rare.

44
00:02:28.373 --> 00:02:30.961
>> [LAUGH]
>> But let's say it was like some really

45
00:02:30.961 --> 00:02:33.710
crazy font or whatever, and
I sent this to somebody else.

46
00:02:33.710 --> 00:02:35.490
They won't have that font file.

47
00:02:35.490 --> 00:02:39.120
So I'd have to package it,
which you can totally do, right.

48
00:02:39.120 --> 00:02:40.603
You just go to File Package.

49
00:02:40.603 --> 00:02:41.945
And its just goes ahead and

50
00:02:41.945 --> 00:02:46.158

51
00:02:46.158 --> 00:02:50.614
But I don't want that, okay,
I want this to just be shapes, okay.

52
00:02:50.614 --> 00:02:52.100
So how do you do it?

53
00:02:52.100 --> 00:02:54.398
It's quite easy,
you go to the black arrow tool.

54
00:02:54.398 --> 00:02:57.140
You can right-click, if you wanted to.

55
00:02:57.140 --> 00:03:01.830
Or you could also go to the Type menu and
you can create outlines.

56
00:03:01.830 --> 00:03:06.100
And as soon as you create outlines,
it's going to create the group.

57
00:03:06.100 --> 00:03:07.340
You can see up here at the top,

58
00:03:07.340 --> 00:03:12.020
in the tool options bar, that this
is now just a group of shapes, okay.

59
00:03:12.020 --> 00:03:15.138
So then you can do whatever you
want with it, I can ungroup it.

60
00:03:15.138 --> 00:03:19.909
And this is where, if I'm doing logos,
when I’m creating a logo, and

61
00:03:19.909 --> 00:03:21.560
I have the name of it.

62
00:03:21.560 --> 00:03:23.809
When I'm done with the logo,
I'm finished, and

00:03:23.809 --> 00:03:27.260
I'm ready to start putting it wherever,
I never have is as a font.

64
00:03:27.260 --> 00:03:28.378
It's always-

65
00:03:28.378 --> 00:03:29.370
>> In shapes.

66
00:03:29.370 --> 00:03:30.370
>> Because?

67
00:03:30.370 --> 00:03:32.890
>> Because then it's all vectors, right?

68
00:03:32.890 --> 00:03:37.481
If I'm sending this to a T-shirt company,
or I'm gonna put it on a book or

69
00:03:37.481 --> 00:03:42.087
